required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of IBI311 in Subjects With Active Thyroid Eye Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-masked, Placebo-controlled Phase II Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of IBI311 in Subjects With Active Thyroid Eye Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, randomized, double-masked, placebo-controlled Phase II study in subjects with active thyroid eye disease. Approximately 33 subjects meeting study eligibility criteria will be randomly assigned to IBI311 or placebo on day 1 (D1) in a 2:1 ratio stratified by smoking status

primary_outcome.measure: The proptosis responder rate of the study eye (defined as percentage of subjects with a ≥ 2mm reduction from Baseline in proptosis in the study eye, without deterioration [≥ 2 mm increase] of proptosis in the non-study eye) at Week 12.
primary_outcome.description: proptosis assessment: amount of protrusion of the eye from the orbital rim measured by Hertel exophthalmometer

secondary_outcome.measure: The overall responder rate in the study eye at Week 12 and 24
secondary_outcome.description: Responder rate were defined as participants with a reduction in clinical activity score (CAS, see Secondary Outcome Measure 2 description for details) of ≥ 2 points, and a reduction in proptosis of ≥ 2 mm in the study eye, and no deterioration (increase in CAS of ≥ 2 points or increase in proptosis of ≥ 2 mm) in the non-study eye.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with a CAS value of 0 or 1 in the study eye at Week 12 and 24. Mean Change of the CAS value in the study eye from Baseline to Week 12 and Week 24.
secondary_outcome.description: According to the 7-item European Group on Graves' Ophthalmopathy (EUGOGO) amendment, CAS was used to evaluate clinical activity. For each of the following items, one point is given: spontaneous orbital pain, gaze evoked orbital pain, eyelid swelling that is considered to be due to active (inflammatory phase) Graves' ophthalmopathy (GO), eyelid erythema, conjunctival redness that is considered to be due to active (inflammatory phase) GO, chemosis, and inflammation of caruncle or plica. The sum of these points is the total score, with 0 indicating no clinical activity and 7 indicating the most severe clinical activity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change of the CAS value in the study eye from Baseline to Week 12 and Week 24.
Mean change from Baseline to Week 12 and Week 24 in proptosis measurement in the study eye.
secondary_outcome.description: proptosis measurement: see Primary Outcome Measure 1 description for details

secondary_outcome.measure: The proptosis responder rate of the study eye at Week 24.
secondary_outcome.description: proptosis responder rate: see Primary Outcome Measure 1 description for details

arm_group.arm_group_label: Fron D0 to W9, treat with Placebo,q3w, IV; From W9 to W21, treat with IBI311, q3w, IV;
From D0 to W21, treat with IBI311, q3w, IV

intervention.description: 10 mg/kg on Day 1 followed by 20 mg/kg q3W for the remaining 7 infusions
intervention.arm_group_label: From D0 to W21, treat with IBI311, q3w, IV
Fron D0 to W9, treat with Placebo,q3w, IV; From W9 to W21, treat with IBI311, q3w, IV;

intervention.description: q3W for first 4 infusions, 10 mg/kg on W12 followed by 20 mg/kg q3W for the remaining 4 infusions
intervention.arm_group_label: Fron D0 to W9, treat with Placebo,q3w, IV; From W9 to W21, treat with IBI311, q3w, IV;
